body:
You can assign skills to your students by highlighting them from our practice pages, but because students may choose to refresh on fundamental skills before testing themselves on their grade level, there is no way to restrict them from going into other grades. Skills can be assigned to all of your classes and students by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click a subject (e.g. Math or Science) at the top of the page.
3) Click to select appropriate grade from the tabs on the left. This opens the list of all skills available in that grade.
4) Move your mouse to the left of the graph icon of a skill you wish to assign. An outline of a star will become visible.
5) Click the star to color it gold and highlight that skill for students to practice.

When your students sign in to ixl.com and view their skills, they will see stars next to the skills you have selected. Also, if they practice from their iPad apps, they can tap the Search icon at the bottom of the app to select the option to view their assigned skills.

The Student report in Analytics will show a summary of all of your students' work in a given time frame. In addition, you can also filter your Analytics to only display work within grade level for all of your students. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click on the Analytics tab at the top.
3) Click on Students near the top.
4) Click on Grade near the top.
5) Select the grades you would like to view progress for.

Once you've selected the grades you would like to view progress for and click Done, the list will automatically refresh to only show work in those grades.
closing: default
name: Block or limit access

body: Students who achieve a SmartScore of 80 in a recommended skill may see a small increase in their scores. Students who achieve a SmartScore of 90 or higher will see the maximum amount of change.
closing: default
name: Growth in diagnostic after practicing

body:
As students practice skills and answer questions on the Continuous Diagnostic, they generate math recommendations based on their performance. These recommendations are separated into several categories:

Try something new: A skill that is a recommended entry point to a topic area students havenâ€™t practiced yet

Work it out: A skill that helps target one of a student's trouble spots. These are not trouble spot skills, but are supporting skills that help with a skill a student is struggling with. Once students build confidence with a "Work it out" skill, they are more prepared to tackle the trouble spot skill.

Next up: A skill that builds on something they've already learned (reached a score of 90 or above)

Keep at it: A skill students are making progress in, but have not yet demonstrated excellence (90 or above) in. These are not skills students are currently struggling with. However, if they were struggling with a skill in the past, IXL might suggest that skill later on as a "Keep at it" to encourage them to try again using the new knowledge they have gained since their first attempt. 

Go for gold: A skill that they've demonstrated excellence in but havenâ€™t yet mastered.

From the Diagnostic arena: A skill recommended to students based on their diagnostic levels. These are not trouble spots or skills they are struggling with. These skills are at the perfect level of difficulty for them to learn now, and are intended to help them grow from where they are.

When students sign in to IXL, their personalized recommendations wall is the first page that loads. The student's recommendations creates an individual learning experience and gives students the tools to practice at their own pace.
closing: default
name: Individualizing Instruction on IXL

body:
IXL can be one of the tools you use for progress monitoring by using the SmartScores your students earn over time while practicing.  You can choose skills for your students to practice based on the standards you are teaching, and have them practice a certain number of questions regularly, and watch their scores adapt over the course of the year.

If you are implementing progress monitoring with your entire class, you may find it helpful to suggest skills to your students through IXL. You can suggest skills, which will highlight them on your students' practice pages, by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in. 
2) Click Learning at the top of the page, then choose a subject (e.g. Math or Science).
3) Click to select an appropriate grade from the tabs on the left. This opens the list of all skills available in that grade.
4) Move your mouse to the left of the graph icon () of a skill you wish to assign. An outline of a star () will become visible.
5) Click the star to color it gold and highlight that skill for students to practice.

When your students sign in to IXL.com and view their skills, they will see stars next to the skills you have selected.
closing: default
name: Progress monitoring

However, when students navigate to their recommendations this way, skills from the Diagnostic will be highlighted with a colored border to set them apart from other types of recommendations. Additionally, students can click the small pyramid icon at the bottom right-hand corner of any math recommendation to show only math recommendations.

body:
If your browser keeps going to the "technical difficulties" page, your browser may not be loading all of the files necessary to show the next exercise.

A good first step to try is to update your browser to the latest version available and make sure that any unknown extensions installed on your browser are disabled. You can find a guide to disabling your browser extensions here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/Extensions/extensions.html

If you prefer, you can switch to a brand new browser instead. Over time, a browser's security settings can change and add-ons can be installed. Starting with a new browser will solve most issues caused by extensions, security settings, or being out of date, and this will allow you to be able to see the questions on IXL again.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, you can use it to go to IXL and you should have no further difficulties viewing questions.

If you have any questions, please let me know. If it's more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x2. I want to make sure that you get the most out of IXL.
closing: default
name: Technical difficulties

body:
You can estimate a student's readiness to work on skills by thinking of 630 as "6 grade 3 months" and 660 as "6 grade 6 months".

Every grade level is represented by 100. Students with a score in the 500's are practicing at a fifth grade level, and students with a score in the upper 500's are almost ready to start practicing sixth grade level work.
closing: default
name: What does diagnostic score mean?

body: IXL's Continuous Diagnostic groups students working at similar levels and can show the most common skill recommendations for each of the student groups, allowing you to plan for small-group instruction.  In this way, your Diagnostic reports will tell you exactly what students know and what to do next to to help them improve.
closing: default
name: How does diagnostic group students?

body: The IXL Diagnostic does not have a set length or time. It adapts to students and presents questions that help our algorithm determine their level of knowledge. In order to do this, students will need to answer about 60 to 90 questions before their complete diagnostic data is revealed. However, this doesn't need to be done in one sitting and the number of questions needed will vary based on each student's performance. After a student's diagnostic data has been revealed, we recommend students answer about 5-10 diagnostic questions per week to keep the IXL Diagnostic current.
closing: default
name: How long to allow for Diagnostic

body: The IXL diagnostic is continuous, and students can continue diagnosing at any time through their accounts. Once the student has finished the initial diagnostic, we recommend students answer about 5-10 diagnostic questions per week to keep the IXL diagnostic up to date, although students can practice more to update the diagnostic results whenever they like.
closing: default
name: When should students retake diagnostic?

body:
Since the diagnostic is designed as an ongoing assessment, students' overall score will change as they answer questions in the diagnostic and practice on IXL. The changes in these scores indicate their growth overall and in the six different strands. To keep track of their growth from week to week, you can print an individual student's diagnostic level by following these steps:

1) Go to https://www.ixl.com and sign in.
2) Click Analytics at the top of the page.
3) Click Diagnostic in the bar underneath Analytics.
4) Click the icon of a piece of paper to the right of a student's level.
closing: default
name: Growth in Diagnostic (growth model)

Students can access "Recommendations" on the iPad app by tapping on the search icon located at the bottom of the screen.

In the meantime, you can chart your students development over time using the Diagnostic by printing their current diagnostic results and then periodically as needed. You can view and print individual student IXL Diagnostic reports. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to https://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Analytics at the top of the page.
3) Click Diagnostic in the bar underneath Analytics.
4) Click the icon of a piece of paper to the right of a student's level.
5) Press Ctrl + P (Cmd + P on a Mac) to print your student's levels.

If your students do use calculators, the reports will reflect their level of computational fluency while using outside tools. To unhide the grade levels for your students, please ask the other teacher to follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin/CUSTOM and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) In the Profiles and settings window, scroll down to the Settings section and uncheck the Hide grade levels check box. The setting change will apply to everyone on your account.
4) Click Submit.

Once your students sign in at http://www.ixl.com/signin, they will see grade levels instead of letters.

body:
The usernames and passwords are sent from ixl@ixl.com. The reports are sent from reports@ixl.com. Technical support e-mails are sent from help@ixl.com. Also, please make sure that the following domains and subdomains are whitelisted on all network firewalls and proxy servers:

www.ixl.com
api.ixl.com
ixl.com
cloudflare.com
cdn.optimizely.com
cloudflaressl.com

In addition, all IXL's traffic is sent securely via SSL. This can cause the app to show a connection error even when Safari allows members to visit www.ixl.com without any difficulties. Please make sure that your filters include an SSL decrypt exception for ixl.com. This will prevent secure traffic from being modified or decrypted by your filters as it is sent to our app.
closing: default
name: School filters - iPad

body:
The students cannot change their scores in IXL. They can temporarily change the score that is displayed on their screen, but the changes students make aren't saved to our servers. There is no way for students to manipulate their true scores or the data in the reports. Refreshing the page (Ctrl+F5) will make the text go back to normal and will display the accurate scores and information once again.

Your student showed you a feature available on all browsers called "development tools." When students visit any page on the internet, the page is saved and displayed by their browser. All browsers have tools that allow you to change the HTML on that page, allowing students to change the way the SmartScore appears, the headlines at major news site, or anything else they want to modify online. The changes they made affect their browsers only and disappear as soon as they navigate to another page.
closing: default
name: Developer tools

body:
Your children will only receive a message about reaching the daily practice limit when practicing as guests. If your children are not signed in, or they are practicing a subject to which they are not subscribed, IXL will consider them a guest.

IXL allows guests to complete 10 free questions in each subject each day, after which they are notified that they have reached their daily practice limit and must sign in or subscribe.

If your children are subscribed to the subject they are practicing, I suggest monitoring them as they sign in to their accounts. On an iPad, you can make sure each child is signed in to their own profile by tapping the little icon of a person in a circle at the bottom of the app. This shows which profile they are signed in to, and you can tap a profile to change it. While your children are signed in, they will be able to practice an unlimited number of questions and won't be asked to subscribe.
closing: default
name: Daily practice limit Family iPad

body:
Your child will only receive a message about reaching the daily practice limit when they are practicing as a guest. If a child is not signed in, or is practicing a subject to which they are not subscribed, IXL will consider them a guest. IXL allows guests to complete several questions for free each day, but after that they are notified that they have reached their daily practice limit and must sign in or subscribe.

If your child is subscribed to the subject they are practicing, I suggest monitoring them as they sign in to their account. The "Welcome, [child's name]" message will appear in the upper right-hand corner of the page as long as they are signed in. While your child is signed in, they will be able to practice an unlimited number of questions and won't be asked to subscribe.

body:
A good first step to try is to make sure that any unknown extensions installed in Chrome are disabled. You can disable your browser extensions in Chrome by following these steps:

1) Open Chrome.
2) Click the three vertical dots in the upper right-hand corner.
3) Go to More tools and then click on Extensions.
4) Next to the extension you want to disable, uncheck the box next to Enabled.

Once you disable any extensions that are stopping IXL from working on your Chromebook, you should be able to practice again.

If you're still unable to practice after disabling extensions, please let me know what steps you were taking when you noticed the issue and any error messages you saw. This information will help me understand what's happening and will allow me to assist you.
closing: default
name: Canâ€™t see graphs-Chromebook

body:
It sounds like files used to display questions are being cached incorrectly, either on individual students' Chromebooks or by your school's network. Clearing the cache on your students' Chromebooks will help them reload all the files needed to display questions directly from our servers. Please follow the steps here to clear the cache on an affected student's Chromebook:

https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/95582?hl=en

If questions still do not load, then it is not the Chromebooks but your school's network that is blocking or caching data from IXL. Please have your lab's IT professional add cloudflare.com, www.ixl.com, and ixl.com to the list of trusted sites on any firewalls or proxy servers your school uses. Traffic from IXL should be allowed through your security and content filters without restrictions. If needed, we have a list of common firewalls and the steps for adding trusted sites to them here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/IXL/SchoolWhiteList.pdf

In addition, no content from IXL should ever be cached by proxy servers at your school.
closing: default
name: Chromebooks caching

body: If more than one Chromebook is displaying words not spaced out correctly and some words appearing on top of others, there is a network level caching issue. Please set a rule on any proxy servers at your school to not cache content from IXL and also clear the cache. This will solve the issue and the words will display properly again on the Chromebooks.
closing: default
name: Text not display correctly, Chromebook

body:

body:
From your description, it sounds like you may need to clear the cache on your iPad. Once the cache is cleared, you should be able to view all the solution pages while practicing.

To clear the cache, please follow the steps here:

http://lww.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/5007/~/how-do-i-clear-the-cache-on-my-ipad%3F
closing: default
name: Clear cache on iPad

body: To clear a Chrome browser's cache, open up Chrome and press Ctrl+Shift+Del on your keyboard. This will prompt you to clear your browser's cache and reload all files from our servers.
closing: default
name: Clear cache on Chrome

body:
If you're not able to open and print certificates from your e-mail, you can access them from your account. All students' certificates are also available in our Certificates center. You can view and print certificates that students have earned by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Learning.
3) Click Awards.
4) Click Certificates center.
5) Select the entire class, all students, or a student from the drop-down menu near the top.
6) Click View certificate to see the desired certificate.

You will then be able to press Ctrl+P (or Cmd+P on a mac) to print the certificate.
closing: default
name: Canâ€™t open certificates from email

body:
You can access certificates your children have earned by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Learning.
3) Click Awards.
4) Click Certificates center.
5) Select the childâ€™s name from the drop-down menu.
6) Click View certificate to see the desired certificate.

You will then be able to press Ctrl+P (or Cmd+P on a mac) to print the certificate.
closing: default
name: Print certificates for children-family

body:
You can print customizable certificates by going to the following link:

https://www.ixl.com/inspiration/printable-resources

You can right click any certificate to download it to your computer. When you open it, you can type in your child's name and information and print it out.
closing: default
name: Customizable certificates

body: The certificates are not generated from a single dayâ€™s work, but the total amount of time spent on IXL. Your child has spent TIME on IXL since START, so he got a certificate to celebrate. The more your child practices on IXL, the more achievements they will earn for the amount of time spent and the number of questions answered.
closing: default
name: Certificates are cumulative

body: It looks like a few of your students have been practicing LOWER skill in addition to their HIGHER work, which is why you received a certificate for practice completed in LOWER. Students sometimes practice lower-level skills for fun in between more challenging skills, and certificates are automatically sent based on the skills students on your roster have practiced. Your students will continue to earn certificates for HIGHER as well.
closing: default
name: Certificates for lower grade levels

body:
To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Open the IXL app from the home screen and sign in.
2) Tap the star icon at the bottom of the screen.
3) Tap and hold the award you would like to use as a display picture.
4) Tap Set as icon underneath the picture.

Your award will now be your new profile icon.
closing: default
name: Move award to profile icon when in iPad

body: You can have any one of your awards as your profile icon. When looking at the board of awards you have earned, you can click and drag an award to the top-right corner by your name. When you drop the award on your name, it will show the award as your new icon.
closing: default
name: Move award to profile icon

body: You can practice an unlimited number of questions from the parent profile to preview a skill your child is practicing, but none of the work completed from the parent profile is saved. However, your child's practice is recorded whenever they practice and can be viewed in Analytics.
closing: default
name: No work saved in parent profile

body:
You can view individual student performance on a skill in the Questions log report by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Analytics.
3) Click Questions log.
4) Select the skill from the Select skill drop-down menu.

You can scroll down to see the session dates and detailed information about each session.
closing: default
name: Questions Log

body:
You can follow these steps to remove a class from your course:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Go" button for your course.
3. Go to the "Options" tab.
4. Click "Delete Class".
5. Select the class you want to delete from the list and click "Delete".

Quia will delete the class. Any students who were enrolled in that class will be dropped and their results will be lost.
closing: Thank you for using Quia! Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Delete Class

body:
When you purchase your online book directly from Quia, access to the book is instantly added to your Quia account. Your book access is not a physical book or book key that you receive in the mail. Instead, it's an electronic book.

If you go to http://books.quia.com and log in to your account, you will see that access to your book has been enabled. Enter your course code, if necessary, and you will be able to open your book and complete your assignments.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions!

body:
You can follow these steps to delete a course:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Go" button for the course you want to delete.
3. Go to the "Options" tab.
4. If you have any classes in your course, you will need to delete them first by clicking the "Delete class" button for each.
5. Click "Delete Course".

These steps will delete a course that has already ended as well as a course that is still active.

You can follow these steps to export your students' results to a CSV file:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Go" button for your course
3. Go to the "Options" tab.
4. Click "Export results".
5. Select the section you want to export. To select more than one section, press and hold the "CTRL" key as you click on each section with your mouse.
6. Click "Export".
7. Make a selection at the prompt to either open the file or save it to your computer for future use.

body:
Thank you for reaching out. I'm happy to refund the charge.

Although we do our best to indicate that our memberships are set to renew automatically, it seems that this was not clear and I apologize for the confusion. It looks like we didn't receive a cancellation request, and as a result your membership remained active.

I have now canceled your membership and refunded the AMOUNT charge. Refunds usually take about 5-7 business days to appear on your statement.
closing: If you have any questions, let me know and I will be happy to assist you. You may also call us at (855) 255-8800 from 8 a.m. - 7 p.m. ET, and please feel free to ask for me by name.
name: Refund with Explanation

body:
I see that you currently have a US membership with the Core subjects package: math, language arts, science, and social studies. Science and social studies are only available on the US edition. Switching country editions will cause you to lose access to the science and social studies portions of your membership.

In addition, because questions differ according to country edition on topics such as currency and measurement, switching editions will mean that you will no longer have access to the practice results that your child has completed in the US edition.
closing: Would you still like to change editions? Let me know how you would like to proceed!
name: Switch International Edition (lose SC/SS)

body:
If you would like to turn off the weekly e-mail reports that you've been receiving, you can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the window that opens.
4) Clear the Receive weekly summary e-mails checkbox.
5) Click Submit to save your changes.

You will no longer receive weekly reports on your students. If you would like to re-enable these reports, you can follow these same steps but check the box in step 4.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help.
name: Turn off e-mail reports

body:
If problems are not appearing at the computers at your school, your school's network security settings may need to be adjusted. Security used to protect your school's network may be mistakenly blocking or altering data coming to and from IXL.

Please have your school's IT professional add cloudflare.com, ixl.com and www.ixl.com to the list of trusted sites on any firewalls or proxy servers your school uses. If needed, we have a list of common firewalls and the steps for adding trusted sites to them here.

Traffic from IXL should be allowed through your security and content filters without restrictions. In addition, no content from IXL should ever be cached by proxy servers at your school. You will then be able to see the questions on IXL once more.

body:
There are two Diagnostic tabs because one is where students go to diagnose their math levels, and the other is where teachers go to see the results of those assessments.

The Diagnostic under Learning shows you what your students will see when they access the Diagnostic to answer math questions and find their proficiency across several different strands. Their results will all be saved and displayed in the Diagnostic under Analytics

When your students sign in, they will be automatically go to Learning and will be able to see the Diagnostic as well as skills from the subjects they practice. When you sign in, you will be brought to Analytics where you can quickly and easily see how your students are doing.

The IXL iPad app, available for free in the App Store, is the best way to practice on the iPad. body:
If you have followed the steps to clear your browser's cache and are still unable to view questions on IXL, your browser may not be loading all of the files necessary to show those exercises.

A good first step to try is to update your browser to the latest version available and make sure that any unknown extensions installed on your browser are disabled. You can find a guide to disabling your browser extensions here.

For a more reliable solution, however, I recommend switching to a brand new browser instead. Over time, a browser's security settings can change and add-ons can be installed. Starting with a new browser will solve most problems caused by extensions, security settings, or being out of date, and this will allow you to be able to see the problems on IXL again.

Mozilla Firefox is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.firefox.com

Click on the button to download Firefox and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Firefox installed, open it to go to IXL and you should have no further difficulties viewing problems.

body:
The time that IXL reports includes only the amount of time a child spends actively practicing problems. It does not include, for instance, the amount of time that a child may spend signing in to and navigating IXL. It also does not include any time spent in the IXL Diagnostic.

The clock that records time on IXL pauses after a child has spent a certain amount of time on a single problem. This is to ensure that when children step away from the computer or take a break from practicing on IXL that their reports don’t mistakenly report that time as time spent practicing. The amount of time a child can spend on an individual problem before the timer pauses varies by grade level as follows:

  • Pre-k to 2nd grade: Two minutes per problem
  • 3rd grade to 5th grade: Four minutes per problem
  • 6th grade and higher: Six minutes per problem


When the timer pauses during practice, children will still get 2-6 minutes of credit for the problems they are working on, depending on their grade level. As soon as their answers are submitted to IXL the timer resumes counting and they receive credit for practicing the next problem.

If you feel some practice is not being accurately reported, please let me know what skills were practiced, and when, and I can check your reports to find out exactly what happened.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.

body:
It sounds like your browser (Internet Explorer) is blocking some of the images we're trying to display.

Please follow these steps to configure IE to allow our site to display images:

1) Open Internet Explorer and go to http://www.ixl.com
2) Click Alt+X on your keyboard to open the Tools menu.
3) Select Internet Options.
4) Click the Security tab.
5) Click Trusted sites.
6) Click the Sites button.
7) Make sure the Require server verification (https:) for all sites in this zone check box is NOT selected.
8) If the text "http://www.ixl.com" is not entered in the box next to the Add button, enter it now. Otherwise, proceed to the next step.
9) Click Add.
10) Click Close.
11) On the Security tab, look at the area labeled Security level for this zone. If you can, click the Default level button.
12) Move the slider to Low.
13) Click OK.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know. If it's more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x2. Feel free to ask for me by name. I want to make sure you can take full advantage of all of the skills on our site!

While we cannot merge the data from two accounts, we can swap the data so that your child’s progress from the older school account will now be transferred to the newer account. However, this will mean that any existing progress in the older account will be cleared, so we do need permission from the schools to make this transfer.

To get started transferring STUDENTNAME’s practice over to the new account, I will first need the following:

1) E-mail permission from your child’s older school along with the older username originally provided by that school. Please ask PRIMARYCONTACTNAME at that school to write to help@ixl.com granting permission to transfer your child's data.

2) E-mail permission from your child’s new school with the new username your child will be using. While permission cannot come from your child’s teacher, they will be able to request this transfer from the principal or other designated staff member on your behalf.

Please ask each school to include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber} in their e-mails. Once I have received an e-mail from both schools at help@ixl.com giving me permission to move the information over to the new school account, I will be able to transfer the data.

If students are not signed in, or they are practicing a subject to which they are not subscribed, IXL will consider them a guest. IXL allows guests to complete several problems for free each day, but after that they are notified that they have reached their daily practice limit and must sign in or subscribe.

body:
While I can clear the data from your childâ€™s account, please be aware that all report data, practice in all grades, and awards will be lost. You have a couple of options to get the most out of IXL:

1) Keep practicing! As children practice on IXL, their SmartScores will quickly adjust to their current level, so even if they have low scores on a skill, as long as they continue to practice the SmartScore will adjust to accurately show their current performance levels. If they have already mastered a skill, they can practice again and will see their SmartScores reset to 0. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options in your reports to monitor their progress.

2) Delete all data. We can clear out all practice data, awards, and account history, and you will have a brand new account to use with your child.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: Please let me know which option you would prefer, or if you have any questions about how to use Analytics to track your child's progress.  I will be happy to help!

body:
Our Diagnostic is our newest feature and although we are working to release a Diagnostic for ELA soon, our first release is only available for Math. In the meantime IXL tracks each student's ELA progress in up-to-the-second reports that can show you their levels of improvement and preparedness across time.

The questions on IXL are adaptive, meaning that as students practice them and improve in a skill, the questions will become more difficult. If they get questions wrong, the questions start getting easier. In this way students from a wide range of readiness can practice the same skills, and each student will receive questions of appropriate difficulties.

After your students have spent a bit of time practicing on IXL in a grade level that is close to their age group, I recommend browsing through our reports. Their final SmartScores in a few skills will give you an excellent impression of whether or not they should try an easier or more difficult grade level instead.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us. I'm glad to hear that you've discovered our new Diagnostic!
closing: Please let me know if you have any other questions. I'm always happy to help!

body:
The "Connection error" message indicates that traffic between our app and our servers is being blocked or modified. Please have your school's IT professional make sure that the following domains and subdomains are whitelisted on all network firewalls and proxy servers:

www.ixl.com
api.ixl.com
ixl.com
cloudflare.com
cloudflaressl.com
optimizely.com

In addition, all of IXL's traffic is sent securely via SSL. This can cause the app to show a connection error even when Safari allows members to visit www.ixl.com without any difficulties. Please make sure that your filters include an SSL decrypt exception for ixl.com and optimizely.com. This will prevent secure traffic from being modified or decrypted by your filters as it is sent to our app.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If you prefer, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x2. Feel free to ask for me by name. I am happy to help!
name: iPad app connect error school-Safari OK

body:
If exercises are not being displayed on our website, your browser may not be loading all of the files necessary to show those exercises.

A good first step to try is to update your browser to the latest version available and make sure that any unknown extensions installed on your browser are disabled. You can find a guide to disabling your browser extensions here.

If you prefer, you can switch to a brand new browser instead. Over time, a browser's security settings can change and add-ons can be installed. Starting with a new browser will solve most problems caused by extensions, security settings, or being out of date, and this will allow you to be able to see the problems on IXL again.

Google Chrome is a fast, secure browser that you can download for free here:

http://www.google.com/chrome

Click on the button to download Chrome and follow the prompts to install it to your computer. Once you have Chrome installed, you can use it to go to IXL and you should have no further difficulties viewing problems.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If it's more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x2. I want to make sure that you get the most out of IXL.
name: No Problem - Families/Individuals

body:
The "Connection error" message indicates that traffic between the iPad app and our servers is being interrupted. To fix this, please try adding IXL as a trusted site on your iPad by following these steps:

1) On the Home screen of your iPad, tap the Settings icon.
2) In the list of settings in the left menu, tap General.
3) In the right menu, scroll down and tap Restrictions.
4) Enter your iPad passcode when prompted to access your list of website restrictions.
5) Tap Websites in the Allowed content section.
6) Tap Add a website... under the Always allow heading at the bottom of the list of allowed websites.
7) Enter "IXL" as the title and "ixl.com" as the URL.
8) Tap Done on your keypad.

Then please try loading the app and practicing again.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If it's more convenient, feel free to contact us at (855)255-6676x2. I will be happy to help you get IXL running properly on your iPad.
name: iPad app connection error (family)

body:
While we cannot merge the data from two accounts, we can swap the data so that your child’s progress from the school account will be transferred to your family account. However, this will mean that progress in the school account will be cleared, so we do need permission from the school to make this transfer.

To get started transferring STUDENTNAME’s practice over to the family account, I will first need e-mail permission from your child’s school along with the username of the account provided by that school. While permission cannot come from your child’s teachers, they will be able to request this transfer from the principal or other designated staff member on your behalf. Please ask the school to e-mail help@ixl.com and include the case number {!Case.CaseNumber} in their e-mails.

Once we have permission from the school, the next step is for you to purchase a new IXL family membership and create a new username and password. After you provide me with this information, I will be happy to transfer the practice data for you.

For pricing information and to purchase a family membership, please click here:

https://www.ixl.com/membership/family/subscribe
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: If you have any questions in the meantime, please let me know. I will be happy to help!

body:
Thank you for reaching out to us, I'm happy to help!

There are a few different types of rewards that can be earned on IXL. Medals and certificates are awarded periodically as children practice. Awards, though, are acquired after specific challenges are met. These challenges vary, with some requiring children to master a certain number of skills in a category, or to practice a certain number of questions. Completing a challenge will allow children to reveal that prize on the awards board.

To see how close you are to earning an award for ELA, go to Learning in your account and click Awards. Select Language arts awards beneath the tabs, if necessary. You will see all the different types of challenges available for your grade. Click on any challenge to see your progress toward that award.

body:
While I can clear the data from your studentsâ€™ accounts, please be aware that all report data, practice in all grades, and awards will be lost. Teachers, parents, and students will no longer have access to the data. We strongly recommend advising them in advance that their accounts will be cleared.To clear the data, I'll need your school's IXL administrator to write in to authorize us to do so.

There are other options available to monitor studentsâ€™ progress if you would like to keep data for teachers, parents, and students to see. If students have already mastered a skill, they can practice again and will see their SmartScores reset to 0. If students havenâ€™t yet reached mastery, they can keep practicing and their SmartScores will naturally adjust to their level of proficiency. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options in your reports to monitor their progress. If youâ€™d like to discuss these options in more detail, please let me know why you would like the data cleared and Iâ€™ll be happy to help explore them.

If you would like to have any students' accounts cleared of data, please ask your school's IXL admin to contact us at help@ixl.com and reference case number {!Case.CaseNumber}.

body:
Follow these steps to upload files to share with your class:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Files" in the left menu.
3. Click "Upload".
4. Click "Browse" to locate the file you want to upload from your computer. (Once you locate the file, select the file and click "Open".)
6. Click "OK".

Your file will now be added to your Quia Files, and will be listed on this page.

To add this new file to your class page, follow these steps:

1. Click "Classes" in the left menu.
2. Click the "Edit" link for the appropriate class.
3. In the "Message to class" field, place your cursor where you want to insert your file.
4. Go to the "Insert" list, located below the "Message to class" field, select the type of file you want to add, and click "Browse".
5. Select the button for the file you want to insert.
6. Click "OK". (You may be prompted to enter a "text anchor", which is just the words you want your students to be able to click to access the file.)

Quia automatically adds the HTML for the file link. When you save and view your page, you will be able to see the image or the link.

To learn more about adding files to your class Web page and editing your class Web page, you can watch our tutorial at:
http://www.quia.com/tutorials/class_edit
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.

Thank you for contacting Quia. I am happy to help.

With an individual subscription to Quia, there is not a way for students to use the same usernames and passwords for multiple Instructor Enroll classes. If there are other teachers at your school who use Quia, you may want to consider purchasing a group subscription that will allow all of you to have a Master Student List. The usernames and passwords created on this Master Student List can then be used in any Instructor Enroll classes on the subscription.

Alternatively, you can create new Student Self-Enroll classes and have your students enroll themselves into multiple classes using the same username and password. With this method, your students will be the only ones to have access to their usernames and passwords.

To learn more about the differences between Instructor Enroll and Student Self-Enroll classes, you can click on the following link:

http://www.quia.com/tutorclass.html

body:
While the data in your child's account can be cleared by the school, our site is designed so that your child never has to start over. The SmartScore for each skill will automatically adapt as your child practices, adjusting the difficulty of the questions and accurately reporting your child's proficiency in that skill.

Even if your child has a low score, the SmartScore will automatically adjust when he/she begins practicing again. When the SmartScore for a skill reaches 100 that skill is considered mastered, but your child can practice the skill over again and the SmartScore will reset to 0. Skills can be mastered over and over, ensuring that any students who use IXL will get all of the practice and reinforcement they need.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: If you still wish to have your child's data cleared, please have an administrator at the school write to us at help@ixl.com.  Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help!

body: Thank you for reaching out to us. Iâ€™m sorry to hear that you have been frustrated by the scoring, and I appreciate that youâ€™ve reached out to let us know. We value your feedback and I will share your experiences with our design team.
closing:
Iâ€™d like to share some information and suggestions that may help make practicing less frustrating.
  • Donâ€™t rush: Challenge Zone questions can be tough, and you need to get several correct answers in a row to reach 100. Check your answers, work carefully, and use the knowledge youâ€™ve gained from earlier questions in the skill.
  • Use IXLâ€™s explanations: The Challenge Zone is about solidifying your skills, so if you miss a question, read the explanation to get the key steps and strategies you need.
  • Take a break and come back: If you are getting frustrated, try practicing a different skill for a while, then come back to that first skill and try again later.
  • Remember that 100 is always within reach: SmartScore is a measure of progress, so no matter how many questions you miss along the way, you always have the chance to reach mastery in a skill on IXL.
I hope you find some of these suggestions helpful. You can visit our SmartScore guide if you would like to learn more about how the SmartScore works.Feel free to reach out with any other questions, and I will be happy to help.
name: SmartScore explained (child)

body:
While there's not a way to reset an individual skill, our skills are designed to naturally adjust to students' current levels of understanding even if theyâ€™ve practiced before. If they mastered a skill previously, it will reset to 0 automatically when they begin practicing again.

To allow students to demonstrate their understanding in previously practiced skills, we recommend having them practice 20 questions or until they reach mastery, whichever comes first. IXL will continue to track their performance, and you can use the date range menu and other options at the top of your reports to monitor their current progress.

body:
Your quizzes can each be copied to a colleague's account one at a time, exported as a collection of questions from your Question Bank, or, if you would like everything copied, I can copy all of your Quia content (quizzes, activities, files, etc.) to your colleague's account at once.

Any quiz can be copied one at a time by logging in to your account at http://www.quia.com/web and clicking the link for the quiz you'd like to copy. Once you've clicked the quiz link, a "Tools" box will appear on the right hand side. You can click the â€œCopy this to my accountâ€ link and a duplicate of the quiz will appear in your account. This link will always be visible as long as the â€œMy Toolsâ€ box has not been disabled in the quiz assignment options. If the box is not appearing, let me know and I can provide steps to enable it.

Another method of sharing quiz questions is to export them. Once you export them, you can share the file with your colleague who can then import the file to his or her Quia account. Exporting quiz questions allows them to keep any labels you have applied to them. To export questions, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2. Click "Question Bank" in your left menu.
3. Click the name of your quiz in the list of quizzes that appears near the bottom of your page.
4. Check the box next to the questions that you would like to export. If you would like to export the entire quiz, check the box at the top of the list of questions to select them all at once.
5. Select "Export selected questions" from the "Actions..." menu at the top of the list.

Your questions will now be exported as a text file. You can now share this file with your colleague or e-mail it. Once your colleague has the file, it can be imported into another Quia account by following these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2. Click "Question Bank" in your left menu.
3. Click the "Import questions" button near the top of the page.
4. Click the "Choose file" button.
5. Select the text file with the quiz questions.
6. Click "Open".

Your quiz questions will now be added to your colleague's Question Bank. If your colleague would like assistance creating quizzes with questions found in the Question Bank, let me know and I'll be happy to provide instructions.

If youâ€™d like me to copy your entire account instead (including activities, quizzes, surveys, and files), let me know and I will gladly provide additional information.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Share Quizzes with other teachers

body:
The captcha messages you are seeing are being displayed because our server security is misinterpreting traffic from your school as malicious. We can temporarily allow your school's traffic through our security, although we will need to work with your network administrator to find a permanent fix.

Please have your network administrator write to help@ixl.com to provide me with the public-facing IP addresses used by the computers at your school.

Once I hear from your network administrator, I can help ensure that you do not see any further captcha messages. Then we will work with your admin to make sure they don't come back.

closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If it's more convenient, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x2. Feel free to ask for me by name. I am happy to help.

Thank you for sending me your school's IP addresses. We have temporarily whitelisted your school so that you will stop seeing the captcha messages.

In three weeks we will remove your school's IP addresses from our whitelist. In the vast majority of cases, this should not cause any interruptions in your students' and teachers' access to IXL. It usually takes about two weeks for an IP address' status to be cleared and stop showing the captcha messages.

In order to make sure that you don't experience any interruption in your service, I will be happy to perform some tests with you before we remove your IP address from our whitelists. If you have some time from Monday to Friday between 8am and 5pm Pacific Time, please let me know when you would like to set up an appointment to test your access to IXL. We can temporarily remove your IP addresses from our whitelists and test access to IXL to ensure there will be no difficulties in the future.

Thank you for working with us as we continue our ongoing effort to maintain the security and reliability of our website.

The quizzes on Quia are completely supported on mobile devices. Some activities, however, utilize Adobe Flash and may not be supported on certain products, such as the Apple iPhone and iPad.

For some of the Quia activities that utilize Flash (Challenge Board, Hangman, and Rags to Riches), you can hide the Flash version of the activity and display the HTML version instead. This will allow you to play these activities on any mobile device, including Apple products! To change one of these activities from the Flash to HTML version, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Activities" in your left menu.
3. Click the "Edit" link for a Flash-based activity.
4. Scroll down to the "Advanced (optional section)" and type "HF" in one of the blank fields provided.
5. Click the "Done" button.

Your students will now be able to practice this activity using the HTML version on their phone or tablet.

Battleship activities require Flash, and are the only content on Quia that cannot be used on mobile devices that donâ€™t support Flash.

It sounds like you are using the Safari browser to access IXL from your iPad.

The IXL iPad app, available for free in the App Store, is the best way to practice on the iPad. The Safari browser on the iPad is not supported by IXL and our app is designed for a much more mobile-friendly format. If you use the app instead of our full site on the Safari browser, it will resolve this issue and provide a much smoother experience while practicing with your tablet!

You can download our app for free by searching the App Store for "IXL practice" or by visiting our home page on your iPad and tapping on the link at the top of the page for the app.

The feedback that your students receive on their quiz results can be changed at any time and ranges from showing "No feedback" to showing "Score, summary, and answers". To change the feedback that your students receive on a quiz, you can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2) Click "Quizzes" in your left menu.
3) Click "Assign" for the quiz you are interested in.
4) Scroll down to "Global settings".
5) On the line titled "Feedback", select the option you prefer from the drop-down menu.
6) Scroll to the bottom of the page and click "Done".

You can change the level of feedback your students see at any time. For instance, when your students first take your quiz you can set the feedback to "Score only". When your students log in to their accounts to view the results of their quiz attempts, they will only be able to view their scores.

Then when students have all completed the quiz and you would like them to receive additional feedback, you can follow these steps again and select, for example, "Score, summary, and answers". If your students return to view their quiz results again, they will be able to see a summary of the questions they answered and the answers youâ€™ve provided for each question in addition to the scores theyâ€™ve earned.

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia Web Support. I will be happy to assist you.

If your students were logged into your quiz and their computers froze, or, they lost connection to the internet, the Quia Web program will go out and attempt to recover the student's submission and/or what the student entered before the incident. However, this can take up to 8 hours to accomplish. I suggest you log back into your account in 8 hours and you should be able to click on "Grade" and on the "pencil icon" next to the student's name to force a submission and see where the student left off before losing connection to the network.

However, if you do not see any submissions or "Abandoned," this means nothing was saved and/or recovered.
closing: Please let me know if you have further questions or need any assistance.
name: Student In-Quiz Lost Connection

body:
There are two enrollment types for your Quia classes--"Instructor enroll" and "Student self-enroll."

With "Instructor enroll," you add each student to your class roster. Upon saving your roster, Quia automatically generates a username and password for each student. You will be able to see your students' passwords with the click of a button. Students will not need to enter a class code with the "Instructor enroll" option. We recommend this enrollment type for younger groups of students.

With the "Student self-enroll" option, Quia will provide you with a class code for students to enter when enrolling. This enrollment process may be more useful if you have older students who can create their own accounts and remember their own usernames and passwords.

You can find even more information about the differences between the two enrollment options at http://www.quia.com/tutorclass.html

To create a class in Quia, log in at http://www.quia.com/web and follow these steps:

1. Click "Classes" in the left menu.
2. Click "Create a New Class".
3. Enter a name for your class and an end date, then choose what type of enrollment it will use.
4. Click "Submit".

You will now see the Class Editor, where you can enter messages for your class, assign quizzes and activities, and much more!

Although all the tutorials in our Tutorial Center are useful (and can be reached by clicking "Tutorial Center" in the left menu when you are logged in), the tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/class_intro will help introduce you to how powerful a tool classes can really be.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Class Enrollment Types/Creating Classes

body:
Based on your description of the issue, it sounds like security used to protect your school’s network may be mistakenly blocking or altering data coming to and from IXL. Please have your school’s IT professional add this list of trusted sites on any firewalls or proxy servers your school uses:

www.ixl.com
api.ixl.com
ixl.com
cloudflare.com
cloudflaressl.com
optimizely.com

Traffic from IXL should be allowed through your security and content filters without restrictions. If needed, we have a list of common firewalls and the steps for adding trusted sites to them here.

In addition, no content from IXL should ever be cached by proxy servers at your school.

Once your school's network settings have been updated, clear the browser's cache on all of the affected browsers so that students are able to see the problems on IXL again. If students are using Chromebooks, please have students restore their browser settings in Chrome while signed in to their Google accounts instead. Here's a link I found that might be useful that shows how to reset the settings on your student's Chromebooks:

https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/3296214
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. If you prefer, I can be reached at (855)255-6676x3. I am happy to help.
name: Network difficulties

body:
To optimize the appearance of your images in Quia, we recommend the following image sizes (in pixels) for each type of activity. Quia will crop an image if it is larger than the recommended size.

Matching With text: 110 x 55
Without text: 110 x 75
Concentration With text: 110 x 35
Without text: 110 x 55
Flashcards Large: 245 x 150
Small: 120 x 75

To check or modify the size of an image on a Windows PC, follow these steps:

1. Open the image using MS Paint (In Windows, click Start->Accessories->Paint).
2. Hit Ctrl and E on your keyboard which shows you the height and width.
3. If necessary, you can change the size to meet the above-mentioned guidelines and click "OK".

On a Mac, you can re-size your images by using iPhoto and following these
steps:

1. Open the image using iPhoto on your Mac.
2. Click the "File" menu and select "Export..."
3. Change the width and height values to a smaller size. 110 X 93 should
work well and you can always adjust this later if necessary.
4. Click the "Export" button.

Macintosh computers running version OS X 10.10 or 10.11, will want to use the link below to resize an image using Preview.

https://support.apple.com/kb/PH5936?locale=en_US
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.

body:
Thank you for reaching out to us. Iâ€™m sorry to hear that you and your child have been frustrated by the scoring, and I appreciate that youâ€™ve reached out to let us know. We value your feedback and I will share your experiences with our design team.

Iâ€™d like to share some information and suggestions that may help alleviate some of the frustration you and your child are experiencing.

For you:
  • What is a SmartScore? The SmartScore is an up-to-the-minute measure of a studentâ€™s progress toward mastery, so you can think of 0-70 as practicing or learning a skill, 71-90 as refining a skill with questions of mid- and high-level rigor, and 91-100 as working through difficult questions to cement mastery. As a result, the SmartScore will go up and down at different rates as your child progresses through a skill.
  • 80 is a great place to start: When your child first begins a new skill, setting a SmartScore goal of 80 is a great place to start. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that your child has a solid understanding of the concept. Later in the month, challenge your child to reach 90, or to master the skill for extra credit.
  • Set goals: Setting goals of answering a certain number of questions a day or practicing for a certain amount of time is another great strategy. Practicing for even just 10 minutes a day is proven to increase fluency and confidence.
For your child:
  • No need to rush: Challenge Zone questions can be tough, and it takes several correct answers in a row to reach 100. Check your answers, work carefully, and use the knowledge youâ€™ve gained from earlier questions in the skill.
  • Use IXLâ€™s explanations: The Challenge Zone is about solidifying your skills, so if you miss a question, read the explanation to get the key steps and strategies you need.
  • Take a break and come back: If you are getting frustrated, try practicing a different skill for a while, then come back to that first skill and try again later.
  • Remember that 100 is always within reach: SmartScore is a measure of progress, so no matter how many questions you miss along the way, you always have the chance to reach mastery in a skill on IXL.
I hope you and your child find some of these suggestions helpful. You can visit our SmartScore guide if you would like to learn more about how the SmartScore works.
closing: Feel free to reach out with any other questions, and I will be happy to help.
name: SmartScore explained (parent)

Your file will now be stored on your Quia account.

Once you have already created your quiz, you can follow these steps to add images or audio to your questions:

1. Go to "http://www.quia.com/web" and log in to your account.

4. Click "Other options" at the bottom of the question.
5. Click the "Get Image" or "Get Audio" button.
6. The files you have uploaded to your Quia account will appear. Select the file you wish to use.
7. Click "Ok".
8. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click "Done" to save your changes.

Your question will now display your file for your students whenever they take the quiz.

body:
Below is a listing of the SECRET WORDS that your students will need when they take the National Spanish Examination. Please PRINT OUT this e-mail. You will need the secret words when you get to page 3 of the test administration instructions (which was sent to you in a separate e-mail).

body:
With your Quia account, you can determine how you want the banner at the top of your activities, quizzes, and surveys to appear. You can use the Quia banner, your own HTML banner, or no banner at all.

Your banner must be in the format of an HTML file. If you have an image you want to use as your banner, use the sample below as a guide. When you create your version, substitute "username" with your actual username and "yourlogo.gif" with your own image file. Use a text editor, such as Notepad, to create the file and save it with an extension of ".html". We recommend that the width of your banner be 760 pixels.





Once you have created the file containing your version of the sample text above, you can apply your banner to your Quia page. To apply the banner, you must first upload the HTML banner file, along with its linked image file, to your account using the File manager. You can access your File manager by clicking "Files" in the left menu.

Once you have uploaded your file, you can select it as your banner. To do so, follow these steps:

1. Log in and go to the Corporate settings section:

If you are part of a group corporate subscription and have a link called "Admin Tools" in the left menu, click on that link and then scroll to the "Corporate Settings" section.

If you are not part of a group subscription, you can click the "Account" link at the top of your page and scroll until you see the "Corporate Settings" section.

2. Select the blank field and click "Browse".

3. Select the file, then click "Save changes".

Quia will now display your banner above all activities, quizzes, and surveys you create.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Corporate Banner

body: Accounts become inactive when they are removed from a school's roster of students. I recommend contacting your school to restore your account. If needed, your school's IXL administrator can contact us to restore your account so that it becomes active again and none of the work in your account is lost.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.
name: Account is inactive (student) 2 of 2

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. You can substitute a student, and as long as the number of students that take the exam is the same as the number you registered for, you will not be charged an additional fee.

If you need to substitute a student, simply add him or her to the roster for the appropriate level and ignore the entry for the original student. A new username and password will be generated for the student. Be sure that the student uses the new username when taking the exam. As long as the original student does not take the exam, you will not be charged an additional fee.

To substitute a student, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor account
3. Navigate to the appropriate class roster using the Class drop-down menu in the upper left
4. Type the student's first and last names into a blank row of the roster
5. When you have added the student, click "Save changes"
A username and password will be generated for the new student. Click the lock icon next to the username to view the password.
Simply ignore the entry for the original student.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Substitute a student

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia for assistance with your NJE registration. You can make changes to your NJE registration by following these steps:
body:
1. Go to http://www.quia.com/njeorder
2. Enter the same e-mail address you used to initially register for the NJE.
3. Select the option to update an existing registration.
4. Enter the NJE registration confirmation number that appears at the top of your e-mail confirmation and click "Next."

You will see your NJE registration form with your previous information filled-in. Make any necessary changes here.

5. When you are finished making changes, click "Submit" at the bottom of the page.
6. Review the confirmation page and click "Submit" again to complete your registration.

You can print out the invoice page for your records, and an updated confirmation message will be sent to you via e-mail.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Updating NJE Registration

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click the "Account" link at the top of the page.
3. Select the appropriate language from the "Enable Language Tools" menu.

In an effort to protect student privacy, I can only discuss student information with you via your school-issued email address. Please update the email address on your account to your school email address by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click the Welcome message in the top-right corner and select Profile & settings from the menu that appears.

4) Click Submit to save your changes.

Once your account has been updated with your school-issued e-mail address, please e-mail me from that address so that I'll be able to assist you.

body:
To start the new school year you can clear your old roster and add your new students. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Roster.
3) Scroll to the bottom of your roster and click the Clear roster link.
4) Confirm your choice and your students will be removed.

Once your roster has been cleared, you will see an empty row where you can add a new student. If you already have students on your roster you may need to click Add students at the bottom right corner of your roster to make the empty row appear. As you save each new student to your roster, that student's account will be created and a username and password will be displayed.

To make things easier for you next year, you can set your school year start date so that a "Clear roster" banner will appear when your next school year begins. To set the start date, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the Profile and settings window that opens.
4) Enter the correct First day of school in the space provided.
5) Click Submit to save your changes.

As the First day of school date approaches, you will see a Clear roster button appear at the top of the page whenever you visit your roster. Clicking on this button will remove all of your students from your roster at once and will allow you to start adding students for your new school year.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to help.
name: Clear roster for new year (BULK only)

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. It sounds like your lab may not have enough bandwidth for all of your students to take the exam at the same time. We recommend that for each student that is taking the test, your connection has 80kbps of bandwidth. If you have 25 students, you would want to have 2mbps of bandwidth. Keep in mind that if there are multiple classes at your school taking it at the same time, the amount of bandwidth that your school will grow proportionately. You can go to www.speakeasy.net/speedtest to test your download bandwidth. Choose "San Francisco, CA" as the location you want to test your speed for to get an accurate idea of your speeds.

You may also contact us via phone at 877-282-4400, x2 for technical support.
closing: Let us know if you have any questions and we will be happy to assist you.
name: Bandwidth

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. Each student may only take the National Japanese Exam once. Students will be automatically barred from taking the exam multiple times. However, if something goes wrong the first time a student takes the test -- for example, if the power goes out, the Internet connection fails, or the student accidentally hits the "Submit" button before completing the test -- you can add attempts for individual students.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Log into your instructor Quia account.
2. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
3. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt (achievement or proficiency).
4. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
5. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.
closing: If you have any questions, please let us know.
name: Adding an additional attempt

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia. I am happy to help!
body:
If your students' quizzes are appearing as "In Progress" then that means that they did not submit or save their work. When they do submit their work, they will always see a confirmation page that states "Thank you. Your quiz has been submitted". If they save their work to complete later instead, they must make sure to click â€œDoneâ€ immediately after clicking "Save for later", or else their attempt will not be saved. If students did not submit their work or save it to complete later, there is no way to recover it.

However, if your quiz's presentation style was set to display "one question at a time", students would have been required to submit each answer before proceeding to the next question. This would save each question they answered to our servers. In this case you will be able to recover their answers to the questions they did submit.

To check if your students' work was partially submitted to Quia and grade their quizzes, you must first wait until their grades are no longer shown as "In progress" and instead have switched to "Abandoned", which takes approximately 6 hours. After the quizzes appear as "Abandoned" in your grading workbench, you can follow these steps to manually grade your students' attempts:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2. Click "Quizzes" in your left menu.
3. Click "Grade" next to your quiz.
4. Scroll down to the "Student Summary" section.
5. Locate one of your student's abandoned quiz attempts.
6. Click the pencil icon to the left of their name.
7. Confirm that you would like to submit your studentâ€™s incomplete quiz attempt.
8. Click "Submit" at the bottom of the page.

Your student's incomplete quiz attempt can now be graded and submitted as if the student had submitted his or her work normally.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: "In Progress" Quia Results

body:
IXL does not include any banners or advertisements at all. Any ads you see are caused by adware, a form of software that can infect your computer. When these types of programs infect your computer, they will display banners and advertisements on any website at any time, including IXL. You can avoid ads by signing in to your account on any uninfected computer, but I strongly recommend that you download an adware removal program so that you can eliminate this software from your system.

There are many varieties of adware removal software available online. While we do not officially recommend any, some of our members have had success with LavaSoft Ad-Aware. Ad-Aware is an adware and malware removal program that can be downloaded to your computer for free here:

www.LavaSoft.com

Once you download the program and run it on your computer, you should not see any more ads or banners while practicing on IXL.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Remove adware

You can hide the grade levels in IXL. When the grade levels are hidden pre-K becomes "Level A", kindergarten becomes "Level B", etc.

To hide grade levels, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) In the Profiles and settings window, scroll down to the Settings section and select the Hide grade levels check box. The setting change will apply to everyone on your account.
4) Click Submit.
5) Direct your students to sign in at http://www.ixl.com/signin. Otherwise, they will see the actual grade levels on the IXL home page.

Once your students sign in at http://www.ixl.com/signin, the grade levels will be hidden.

body: There is not a way to directly integrate Quia with other LMS programs. However, Quia does provide tools to export materials that can then be easily uploaded to  other programs. For example, quizzes, quiz results, class grades, etc. can all be exported as CSV spreadsheets which are easily edited and imported into many other programs. In addition, Quia provides an import tool that allows members to upload pre-formatted quiz questions to their account all at once. This makes it easy to upload questions into Quia and to share quizzes with other colleagues that use Quia as well, and we have a lot of wonderful reports that you can use as tracking tools.

body:
If you log in to your account and click "Quizzes" from the left-side menu, you can assign quizzes and set distribution options by clicking the "Assign" link for the appropriate quiz.

From here you will be able to define and set the following parameters for your quiz:

Classes - You can make your quiz available to anyone or limit it to certain classes by selecting the check boxes for the appropriate class(es). To limit it to one or more classes, you'll first need to set up class rosters if you haven't done this already.

Presentation style - Choose to show questions all at once or one at a time.

Anonymity - Require student names to access the quiz, make names optional, or do not ask for names.

Feedback - Choose how much feedback students see when they submit their responses, including whether or not they see the answers.

Attempts permitted - You can set a limit on the number of times a student can take the quiz, and which score to include in the gradebook.

Time limit - Limit the amount of time students have to complete the quiz. Students will see a countdown timer while they are taking the quiz.

Allow access - Set a date and time range that your quiz will be available to students.

Secret word - Set a secret word or password that students must enter in order to take your quiz.

Security - Enable settings that prevent students from copying questions or answers to other accounts or into other applications.

Below the Global settings section, you can set distribution options per class or even for particular students, as needed. When you are finished setting distribution options, click "Done" at the bottom of the page.

We have an excellent tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/quiz_options that explains quiz distribution settings and the control they offer in greater detail.
closing: If you have any questions about the distribution options available for Quia quizzes or anything else in Quia, please let me know and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Quiz Assigning Options

An individual subscription to Quia is only $49 per year. It is a 12-month subscription, during which you can create an unlimited number of classes, practice activities, quizzes, and more!

For more information about subscribing to Quia or to subscribe online, go to http://www.quia.com/subscription

If you are having trouble hearing the audio on the exam, I recommend that you download and install the latest version of Flash from here:

http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer

Un-check any checkboxes you see for optional downloads, and then click the "Agree and install now" button to download and run Adobe Flash Player. Follow the prompts to complete the installation, and you should then be able to hear all of the audio files.
